column4: guys, i've a usb flash disk... whenever i execute `ls` i get this error ls: cannot access THEME: Input/Output error... what's the best thing to fix this? is this hardware related now?
could be hardware, could be a filesystem issue. Is this a fat or fat32 partition, and does it work in a different system or os?
it's fat16
try "dosfsck" (umount the partition first!)
thanks
if i umount it... how do i dosfsck an unmounted device?
dosfsck /dev/insertdevicenamehere
it says Currently, only 1 or 2 FATs are supported, not 6. what does this mean?
what are you running it on exactly?
if the card has a partition make sure you run it on that, not on the raw device
(so run it on /dev/sdg1, not /dev/sdg)
(replace sdg with your actual card)
it doesn't have partition...
that doesn't necessarily mean it doesn't have one large partition. Does /dev/sd<whatever>1 exist?
this is the result.... http://paste.ubuntu.com/217757/    ... i'm just wondering why does churvalooh, THEME and other folders doesn't appear on nautilus and cannot be deleted?
might want to move some stuff out of the root directory into subfolders (assuming it lets you)
I don't know how unhappy nautilus gets if the root directory is full if it tries to use a trash can there.
can't access THEME, churvalooh and twilight... it says access error from terminal
this folders do not appear on nautilus
dosfsck complains about them too. I'm assuming corruption, either of the filesystem or the hardware kind.
I'd make sure there's a fewer files on the root of the filesystem before trying to repair further though.
i guess i'll just reformat this
thanks!!!!!!
